meanings.definition: A hypothetical force or natural power believed by some to be responsible for various forms of psychic phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The odyle surrounding the haunted house seemed to make the air feel heavy and eerie.
meanings.sent2: She claimed to possess the odyle that allowed her to communicate with spirits.
meanings.sent3: The magician's assistant joked that her odyle was so strong, she could make a coin disappear with just a wave of her hand.
meanings.sent4: The author's words had an odyle that captivated readers, drawing them into the mysterious world he had created.
meanings.sent5: The psychic's odyle was so powerful, it sent shivers down the spine of everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the center of attention or admiration.
meanings.sent1: The odyle of the party was the birthday girl, who was surrounded by friends and family.
meanings.sent2: The movie star's glamorous outfit made her the odyle of the red carpet event.
meanings.sent3: The adorable puppy became the odyle of the neighborhood, with everyone stopping to pet and play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was like an odyle that brightened up the room and lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The talented singer's voice was the odyle of the concert, mesmerizing the audience with its beauty.
